boardgame.name: Pandoria Merchants
boardgame.description:
Overwhelmed by the Goblin hordes, remnants of the Five Realms were forced to flee their prosperous Hiddenlands, eventually establishing their civilizations again in the newly discovered lands of Pandoria. But as they stake their claims and build anew, the old rivalries that were once their downfall resurface. You take on the role of one of these realms, working together with your opponents to develop Pandoria. But all the while, you are also looking to be the dominant realm in the land through gathering resources, building, and learning spells that harness the magic of this mysterious place.

Pandoria Merchants transforms the critically-acclaimed board game into a “roll-n-write” game that you can print at home and play anywhere — even online! In the more streamlined “family” version of the game, you gain valuable spells whenever you close out a region, and instead of managing different resources, every region rewards you with victory points. If you are new to the world of Pandoria, then Pandoria Merchants Family is highly recommended.

For the first time, you can play Pandoria solo:
Your scouts have discovered a hidden valley deep in the mountains, divided by rivers and enormous lakes, a place for your Realm to expand exclusively! But as you begin to settle these new lands, you find that you are not alone: Trolls from the surrounding hills have come to lay claim. As you compete for the most influence in these 8 new territories, the Trolls become stronger. Can you develop your realm fast enough to be the dominant people group when the land is settled?

Pandoria Merchants is one of the most interactive “roll-n-write” games ever created!

Key differences with the Pandoria Boardgame
Pandoria Merchants retains some of the main elements of the board game, but there are several key differences in addition to the components:
You use dice to determine the 2 resources on your “tile”.
The merchants of Pandoria produce an additional Resource: “Crafts”.
You draw your worker on its own hex space, not on a space with a resource.
Workers stay on the board the entire game.
Resource tracks have a capacity of only 5, and every 2 resources over that is exchanged for a victory point.
You can buy any Spell and Building “card” on your sheet, but if you buy all 3 in a column, your opponents are locked out of buying further cards from this column.
There are no special powers for each realm.
The Artifacts and Relics from the Pandoria Artifacts expansion are included in this game.

—description from the publisher

PANDORIA MERCHANTS - Eine "Roll & Write" Version des beliebten Brettspiels Überwältigt von den Goblinhorden, sind die Reste der fünf Völker gezwungen aus ihren fruchtbaren Hiddenlands zu fliehen und ihre Zivilisationen in den neu entdeckten Ländern Pandorias neu zu gründen. Doch während sie ihre Ansprüche abstecken und ihrem Volk neuen Wohlstand bringen wollen, entbrennen erneut Rivalitäten, die einst ihr Untergang waren.
Dein Volk arbeitet mit deinen Gegnern zusammen, um Pandoria zu neuer Blüte zu verhelfen. Doch auch jetzt kann nur das Volk das Land dominieren, dem es gelingt die meisten Ressourcen zu sammeln, Gebäude und Monumente zu errichten, die mächtigsten Zauber zu entfachen und sich die Magie dieses geheimnisvollen Ortes zunutze zu machen.
Pandoria Merchants transferiert das Pandoria Brettspiel in ein „Roll & Write“-Spiel (also würfeln und einzeichnen), das ihr überall spielen könnt, sogar online!
Mit 3 Spielversionen deckt Pandoria Merchants ein breites Spektrum ab: die Familienversion für Einsteiger und Neulinge in der Welt von Pandoria, die reguläre Version, die für Experten geeignet ist und erstmalig auch eine Soloversion, bei der ihr euch mit den Trollen messt.
Das Spiel beinhaltet: 1 Block mit Spielplanbögen, 50 Blatt, beidseitig + farbig bedruckt 1 Block mit Spielerbögen, 50 Blatt, beidseitig + farbig bedruckt 16 Markierungsteine (je 4 in 4 Spielerfarben) 2 spezielle Ressourcenwürfel
Pandoria Merchants ist keine Erweiterung zum Brettspiel, sondern ein eigenständiges Spiel!
Deutsche Version! Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Satana Station
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A runaway space station controlled by a rogue AI.

A haven for scum, pirates, slavers and other ne'er-do-wells, squatting amidst the ruin of the fallen Urlanth Empire, right on the edge of a warzone.

100 shops, services and interesting people for your players to interact with, inspiration for hundreds of adventures and many ideas that can easily be ripped off for other space opera, heavy metal or OSR science fiction games.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: City Domes
boardgame.description:
25 clear, plastic domes to cap off the city tiles!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Trade Fleets & Chairman Seat
boardgame.description: 8 molded ship minis to replace Trade Fleets tiles from Colonies expansion and 1 Chariman Seat for use with Turmoil expansion.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Metal Resource Cubes
boardgame.description:
200 premium metal resource cubes to replace the plastic ones from the base game:

45 gold
30 silver
125 copper

boardgame.name: The Sacred Brand
boardgame.description:
"Just in time to celebrate Pride month, the Sacred Brand have set up their camp! Based on the rather similarly named company of ancient Greek warriors, the Sacred Brand is a mercenary company where lovers of all kinds fight together. Usually hired to slay the strongest of monsters and depose the nastiest of tyrants, the Sacred Brand fights on to right the wrongs of the world.

The warriors of the Sacred Brand are highly trained, capable of using advanced tactics in combat and magic. They fight together in couples or larger units, complementing their abilities with powerful magical tattoos. Players can opt to join the Sacred Brand, or accompany them on assignments, to experience higher level content in a group of powerful companions.

Celebrate the Pride month by adventuring with the Sacred Brand! These mercenaries come in all shapes and colors, all inclusive! Together they form a mercenary camp that can easily be put in any setting or adventure, allowing your adventurers to witness epic, high-level encounters under the protection of characters capable of defeating them.
Tables! By joining the Sacred Brand, you can get a magical tattoo, which improves the combat abilities of you and your partner(s)! So, there’s a d20 table for that! And a d20 table for mercenary camp encounters! And a d20 table for adventure hooks and storyline possibilities!
Gain access to 6 different fighting styles and maneuvers, centered on the synergy between you and one of your party members!
Includes a section of NPC’s and a map of a typical Sacred Brand encampment."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Crazy Kitties
boardgame.description:
Crazy Kitties is a fun, fast paced, card shedding game. Each round is lightning quick and the game is easy to learn and crazy to play. Crazy Kitties is a family friendly game that is a great way to spend an evening with friends or family.

Cover the laser pointer, clap the ball of yarn, knock the glass of water or stick the opponent with a card draw... or 10!

Embrace your kitty mentality and play out of turn if you have an exact copy of the last card played.

There are 3 different types of kitties, spotted, striped and solid, and 7 different types of cards in each suit. On top of that, there are 2 wild cards for a total of 23 different Crazy Kitties! 108 cards in total.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Promised Land (5E)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Explore the ruins of Symbaroum in this introductory setting book for the world's most-popular roleplaying game.

User summary:

This adventure is a system-adaptation from the previously published The Promised Land.
boardgame.rpgseries: The Chronicle of the Copper Crown

boardgame.name: Mobil Ball-
boardgame.description:
Football simulation from 1949.

Players alternate using their cards to move the ball in the opponent's goal.

boardgame.name: Wretched & Alone SRD
Wretched & Alone System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Wretched and Alone (W&A) is a System Reference Document for games based on Chris Bissette’s The Wretched. These systems typically create solo games about struggling alone against insurmountable odds and documenting that struggle.

Generally speaking, they require a block tower, a deck of cards, one or more six-sided dice, and ten tokens of some kind. Some games will vary from this.

This SRD is aimed at designers, writers, and publishers who’d like to publish games that make use of the systems and ideas from The Wretched in their own setting.

boardgame.name: Magic Maze: Maximum Security – Twinples
boardgame.description: From the publisher: "Replace the guard wooden pawns of Maximum Security by those awesome minis."

boardgame.name: Apocalypse the Risen Campaign Setting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Apocalypse the Risen Campaign Setting is a post-apocalyptic fantasy horror roleplaying game. The setting takes place on Earth, twenty-five years after the fall of society in an event known as the Rise. Demons, the dead, mutated horrors, and existential dread wait around every corner. In order to survive the Rise, humanity formed colonies to rebuild civilization. Do you want to continue the fight against the growing Darkness? Of course, that’s why you are here. Survival in this apocalypse requires grit, desire, skill, and maybe a little bit of luck. So join us in the fight!

The Fall came gradually at first. Seals being broken and ancient wards destroyed while we watched the evening news. The signs were all around us, delirious messages sent 280 characters at a time. As the last Seal shattered, the multiverse was ripped asunder. Now dead walk the Earth and demonkind advance through portals long forgotten.

When the Veil tore, Purgatory itself yawned wide. Souls of the past were ripped from their existence in the Grey and found new homes in the bodies of the dead. Corpses awoke from their graves and twisted into reanimation. Known as Risen, these zombies possess an insatiable and indiscriminate hunger.

boardgame.name: Wintermoor Tactics Club
boardgame.description:
It was hard enough for Alicia to make friends at prestigious Wintermoor Academy before the whole school erupted into a snowball tournament! Now, her tiny Tactics Club must transform from nerdy nobodies into the heroes they play in their tabletop campaign, or they'll be disbanded forever.

Discover the sinister truth behind the War of the Clubs in this cozy tactics RPG. Test your strategic mettle against an avalanche of strange and colorful characters. And don't forget to make new friends!

Tactics FOR EVERYONE

Tactical combat with a focus on accessibility, but with lots of depth and customization.

Get to know Wintermoor in visual novel-inspired gameplay. Break down the walls between high school cliques such as Psychic Detectives and Young Monarchists.

MAKE NEW FRIENDS

Write tabletop campaigns to help students overcome their personal problems, and discover their fantasy selves as your club grows.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Crud Creek Nosepickers – Snotlings Bowl Team
boardgame.description:
Snotlings have long admired the game of Blood Bowl from the sidelines, but rarely have they taken to the pitch for… obvious reasons. Well all that’s about to change, as the “Mighty” Crud Creek Nosepickers have blasted down the barriers to bravely (or foolishly) pave the way for their diminutive kin. They're ready to flood the gridiron with a squirming, stinking wave of pint-sized players, along with all the zany contraptions and silly tricks they could dream up in their mushroom-addled brains.

While Snotlings may make Halfling teams look downright athletic, and Goblins seem burly in comparison, what these little blighters have in spades is, well, lots more of themselves! They're so small and energetic, the refs can never keep count of how many are on the field at once! Their numerical advantage, combined with a willingness to bend and break the rules, makes them very unpredictable indeed. In short, Snotlings are all about the sort of wild shenanigans that make Blood Bowl an absolute pleasure to play. Not only are they fun, but they have some devious tricks that can actually win a game from time to time, quite literally keeping your opponent on their toes.

This multipart plastic kit contains all the components you'll need to build the Crud Creek Nosepickers, a Snotling team for use in games of Blood Bowl, containing 12 Snotlings, 2 Snotling Fungus Flingas, 2 Snotling Fun-Hoppas, 2 Snotling Stilty Runnas, and 2 Snotling Pump Wagons! You'll also find 2 turn counters, 2 coins, 4 Snotling-themed balls, 20x 25mm bases, and 2x 32mm bases with holes.

-Key Features-
Flood the field with scrappy underdogs
Rush the pitch with Pump Wagons!
Cheat to win, and have an absolute blas

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition)
Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition

boardgame.name: Alone by Distant Shores
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

At the most distant shore, dark waters lap at the sandy substance of the world grown thin.

To sea is the not-darkness of the void.
Below is the furthest edge of the world, sandy and soft and not one particular thing or another.
Above, on a good day, there are the stars.

Alone by Distant Shores is a hack of Takuma Okada's Alone Among the Stars for one player. It is about wandering the border of the world and the void beyond it, and the things you may experience in that place.

boardgame.name: Mean Streets: War in Gang-infested Cities
boardgame.description:
Mean Streets: War in Gang-infested Cities is a simple, fast-play set of wargame rules for fighting gang battles in the city streets of today, the recent past, or 19th century.
It recreates the romanticized look at street gangs from movies like the 1979 cult classic, The Warriors, or West Side Story.
Each player controls a street gang composed of 5-12 figures, with each figure representing one man.
Gangs can be assigned a huge variety of missions to earn victory points while engaging in "rumbles" with rival street gangs.
Mean Streets includes experience point rules for a continuing series of games, and a complete set of campaign rules to allow players' gangs to wage street battles for control of their city.
Extensive scenario design rules and primary and secondary missions assist players in setting up their own games.

A bibliography gives players inspirational books, movies, and blogs to read to help them create their own world, making it as Hollywood or realistic and gritty as they desire.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 1001 Herbs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the real wold, practically everything that grows has been believed to have some use, real or imagined. Why should a fantasy world be limited to just the plants of the real world? Here are hundreds of instant herbs, all named with their useful parts and effects described.

boardgame.name: Business Card Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Business Card Dungeon is a small dungeon stocked by dice rolls on a series of tables.
...
This is a simple little dungeon, with a map and the tables (30 in total) to describe and stock its 8 locations. Every time you roll up a new dungeon, you'll get something different. And there's no reason you couldn't add a lot more descriptions to those tables. They're fairly short because they were made to work with the free demo version of TableMaster, but your only limit is the size of your dice. It's free; if it entertains you and your friends for an hour or two, I'll feel amply rewarded.

boardgame.name: 101 Dragons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The adventurers, having heard of a dragon lairing nearby, have sought out their prey. They are now approaching the cave reported to be the lair of Heyezos the Terrible, described as enormous, terrifying, and most importantly, red.
...
No more conveniently color-coded dragons! Each and every dragon should be unique, and these certainly are. They come in all sizes, shapes, and descriptions. Some have wings, some have different types of wings, some have none. They have various numbers of legs, different types of heads, etc. Their breath weapons, resistances, personality characteristics, and special abilities all differ, too.

boardgame.name: After The Raid: French And Indian Wars
boardgame.description:
"After The Raid: French And Indian Wars"

After raiding an enemy settlement a small group of Rangers are fleeing through the forest pursued by lots of angry local.

A quick and simple wargame needing only a few figures ideally 28mm but any size of individually based figures will do.
The Rangers have to reach the far table edge and safety the Indians have to stop them.

Comes with plenty of sample stats for the figures to ensure lots of variety in each game and to keep the players guessing about what they will face.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 1001 Townsfolk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The adventurers, after days of hard riding in pursuit of the thief who stole the map to Ecalp, finally reach the gates of the city the thief was heading for. A brief chat with the sergeant of the gate guard (and a few silver coins passed unobserved) confirmed that the thief had entered the city only an hour ahead of them.

boardgame.name: 100 Vid Feeds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides the GM with a quick chart to generate random video feeds in case you have that extra nosey, ask too many questions player (and you haven’t wasted their character yet). Some of these feeds offer adventure hooks while others are more flavor… some, on the other hand are just plain weird. Just like flipping through the channels in our modern era.

boardgame.name: 100 DIY Addict's Home Finds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 things that you might find in a DIY Addict’s house. This list is perfect for modern/crime settings, wasteland worlds, etc.

boardgame.name: Wasteland Foes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This pack contains a variety of foes for your fantasy of Post Apoc setting.

boardgame.name: It Takes a Child to Raze a Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It finally came; the night you had all been waiting for. You gathered the sacred oils and adorned the clay homunculus; lit the incense and said the sacred, deviant words that burnt your tongue and lips.

Finally, your Dark Messiah was born. A daemon mind made flesh, with the sharpness and cruelty of the world below.

Unfortunately, It’s stuck in the body of what is, basically, a human baby and won’t be able to help you out with the next stage of Its plan until It’s a little older. Your work has only just begun…

It Takes A Child To Raze A Village is a mini RPG where you play as cultists gathering ritual components for a petulant and demanding Dark Messiah.
boardgame.rpg: It Takes a Child to Raze a Village

boardgame.name: Star Power
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A cyberpunk adventure for 2 – 5 players as 125pt cyborgs (or other security operatives).

Angel Sierra: pop-culture mega-star, mass-media demi-goddess, teen icon, and PanOptic super-spokes-person. Angel is a top-40’s singer, tv-actress, and hyperpopular personality owned and controlled by the PanOptic mega-corp. She’s world famous, has brandname recognition, and a near-orbital Q-rating.

New York is full of people waiting for their big break. For the guy pouring coffee at your local diner, it’s a part in an off-off-Broadway play. For the girl walking four dogs at once it’s an agent who’ll look at her screenplay. For you it’s a client like PanOptic—a mega corporation that everyone knows and loves. They’re the ones who own all four news streams. They’re the ones who provided round-the-clock coverage of that cool-ass war in Galapagos last year. They’re the ones who do all the big movies, all the big video games, and all the news that’s fun to print!

PanOptic’s got a problem and they think you’ve got a solution. They need someone very valuable to the looked after. Someone you’ve heard of. Someone everyone’s heard of. They need bodyguards for Angel Sierra.

PanOptic needs people who know when to be nice and when not to be. The characters need to be ready and willing to fight with minimum (that means nonlethal) force whenever possible, and just as capable of breaking out the big guns and laying waste when it’s called for.

PanOptic’s a dream client. Angel Sierra’s a goddess. This could be the big break you’ve been waiting for.

boardgame.name: Crusader vs Skeleton: A Micro Chapbook Wargame
boardgame.description:
A necromancer has raised a great Skeleton Army.
The righteous army of the crusaders are determined to thwart this unholy evil.
Who will win?

Crusader Vs Skeleton is a Micro Chapbook Wargame--an ultra-light miniatures skirmish game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook Wargame.

These rules are specially designed for solo play but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a one on one miniatures game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook Wargames for extra options!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: At the Feet of the Moirai
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Moirai are three sisters, Lachesis – The Allotter, who sings of things that were; Clotho – The Spinner, who sings of things that are; and Atropos – The End, who sings of things to come.

They oversee all the paths of human lives as they are spun and woven across the face of The World.

As the Moirai stand above a sea of threads below, their Weavers work to create the greatest tapestry ever known – that of all there is and will be.

As the sisters plan the patterns of the lives in front of them, their Weavers move each individual thread according to their grand plan.

So, The World is woven.

At The Feet Of The Moirai is a mini RPG, where players take on the role of Weavers working for the Moirai. Each Weaver oversees weaving The Thread of a chosen Hero’s story. Their weft and warp will drive their Hero’s deeds and lead them on their allotted paths.
boardgame.rpg: At the Feet of the Moirai
